reviewText: It sure is great to have this show back. Great Show. But when is volume 3 coming out?  Volume 2 stops just short of the first episode with the Mechanikong robot. There will be a volume 3? wont there? Oh  probably not. Since there is no big hollywood movie to cash in on.  I guess its back to bootlegs for all of us Kong Cartoon fans.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Animated series based on the RKO movie which it credits up front in copyright.  Apparently the surviving elements were used without restoration, as there is one episode missing a commercial break and the end credits that I noticed, and the pilot show is a little dirty at the start of a reel.  It's too bad that limited run series still get a test of the waters when they just need to release the whole series at once.  We only get a glimpse of the MechaniKong in a preview for episode 10, which was the primary subject of the movie King Kong Escapes later on.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Obviously, there will be no volume 3. The executive at the company behind the release of these DVDs has probably forgotten all about KING KONG and is looking for something else that is current to cash in on.  Ive been buying videos of classic shows for far too long and I know what it means to get skewered.  Anyone out there owning Ultraman volume 1 on VHS, The Speed Racer or Battle of the Planets DVDs, the Buck Rogers set that is missing the first two episodes, the Twin Peaks season 1 box or any of the impossible to see and horribly edited releases of Star Blazers knows exactly what I am talking about.  Sqeeze 'em out fast, make the quick buck, and vanish into the night like a filthy mugger is the MO of the video producer folks. Sorry to say it. Maybe they will surprise me this time, but I doubt it. My bet is we've all just been mugged.
summary: Where the heck is Volume 3 for crying out loud?
Title: N/A

reviewText: They've got to put out a volume 3.I strongly recomend that you buy this great show. It was the first american show animated in Japan.If you like it, you will also enjoy KING KONG ESCAPES.I also recomend GODZILLA, THE ORIGINAL ANIMATED SERIES Vol.1 and 2,You may also like ULTRAMAN II (animated)You might even like KONG: KING OF ATLANTISPLease try to avoid ULTRAMAN vol. 1 from BCI/BRENTWOOD It is awful and of bootleg quality.
Title: N/A

reviewText: In an obviously crass attempt to force King Kong fans to buy both disks, the pilot, which was later split into two episodes, is divided between the two volumes, with only the second half on this disk and the first half onKing Kong, Vol. 1 (Animated TV Series).  Worse, episode 5 is missing both its Coming Attractions and its End Credits, and Episode 7 is missing its Coming Attractions.All in all a rather shabby presentation of a long, long, LONG awaited DVD release.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am glad they at least made a couple of volume dvds from this series. They did the same with the old classic Godzilla cartoon series as well. If you like very old classic cartoons (1966), then you will enjoy this.  This series only had 25 episodes and if you buy both volume sets, 1 and 2, then you will be getting 8 out of those 25 episodes.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's just as great as the first volume!  Even better in color since a lot of the TVs were in black and white!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Yep it's true Volume 3 was never released so we're stuck with the first two volumes and bootlegs which I can't even find on the internet to be honest. They should release the rest of the series on amazon as a made on demand dvd. The first two volumes are awesome though and you even get the Tom Of T.H.U.M.B. shorts within the episodes. The only negative comment I have besides the fact that the rest of the series has yet to have a dvd release is that the sound quality isn't so great but it's not the worst thing ever.
summary: Fans of this show and King Kong in general would love to see the rest of the series released!
Title: N/A
